Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulation

  • public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Builds troops based on given parameters and simulates a battle between these troops.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a Simultation with the given number of Soldiers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int numRebels,
                  int numJedi,
                  int numTroopers,
                  int numSith,
                  RebelSoldier customRebel,
                  Stormtrooper customTrooper)
        Constructs a Simultation with the given number of Soldiers. All RebelSoldiers and Jedi are considered to be on the side of the Rebellion and will only attack Empire Soldiers. All Stormtroopers and Sith are considered to be on the side of the Empire and wil only attack Rebellion Soldiers.
        Parameters:
        numRebels - The number of RebelSoldiers to include.
        numJedi - The number of Jedi to include.
        numTroopers - The number of Stormtroopers to include.
        numSith - The number of Sith to include.
        customRebel - An 'average' custom RebelSoldier (a subclass of RebelSoldier)
        customTrooper - An 'average' custom Stormtrooper (a subclass of Stormtrooper)

    • Method Detail

      • simulateSkirmish

        public boolean simulateSkirmish(boolean verbose)
        Simultes one round of attacks from every Soldier to another Soldier on the opposing side. Before attacks are made, all ForceSensitives in the simulation are given a 50/50 change to useTheForce. If an attack reports negative damage, the attack has failed and has not harmed the Soldier being attacked. A report of each attack is printed to the console followed by the lsit of Soldiers killed in this skirmish. If there are no Soldiers left in either faction, or no Soldiers have died in the past three skirmishes, false is returned signaling the end of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        verbose - Verbose output on or off.
        Returns:
        True if the simulation can continue, false otherwise.
